column2: Such a uniformity in every particular, is found in no part of nature.
column3: Such a uniformity in every particular, is found in no part of nature.

column2: He also expects that, when he carries his goods to market, and offers them at a reasonable price, he shall find purchasers, and shall be able, by the money he acquires, to engage others to supply him with those commodities which are requisite for his subsistence.
column3: He also expects that, when he carries his goods to market, and offers them at a reasonable price, he shall find purchasers, and shall be able, by the money he acquires, to engage others to supply him with those commodities which are requisite for his subsistence.

column2: I shall therefore change the suppositions.
column3: I shall therefore change the suppositions.

column2: For these are plain and acknowledged matters of fact.

column2: But if the foregoing explication of the matter be received, this must be absolutely impracticable.
